can_make_data_requests.name: can make data requests
can_make_data_requests.description: Allows users to make data requests

can_triage_data_requests.name: can triage data requests
can_triage_data_requests.description: Allows users to accept or deny data requests

can_manage_privacy_budgets.name: can manage privacy budget
can_manage_privacy_budgets.description: Allows users to adjust privacy budgets and accept or deny upgrade request

can_manage_users.name: can manage users
can_manage_users.description: Allows users to accept or deny account requests and reassign roles for users of this domain

can_create_users.name: can create users
can_create_users.description: Allows users to create or edit users

can_edit_roles.name: can edit roles
can_edit_roles.description: Allows users to edit permissions applied to roles

can_upload_data.name: can upload data
can_upload_data.description: Allows user to upload datasets to the domain

can_upload_legal_documents.name: can upload legal documents
can_upload_legal_documents.description: Allows users to upload legal documents in the domain configuration settings

can_edit_domain_settings.name: can edit domain settings
can_edit_domain_settings.description: Allows users to edit domain profile & configuration settings

can_manage_infrastructure.name: can manage infrastructure
can_manage_infrastructure.description: Allows users to delete the node, manage node workers, and adjust auto scaling controls outside of the pygridui environment

owner.name: Owner
owner.description: There is only one Owner account assigned to any one domain node. The owner account is the highest level permission and is a requirement for deploying a domain node. If you should ever want to transfer ownership of your domain node to someone else you can do so by following these steps.

compliance officer.name: Compliance Officer
compliance officer.description: This role is for users who will help you manage requests made on your node. They should be users you trust. They are not able to change domain settings or edit roles but they are by default able to accept or deny user requests on behalf of the domain node.

data scientist.name: Data Scientist
data scientist.description: This role is for users who will be performing computations on your datasets. They may be users you know directly or those who found your domain through search and discovery. By default this user can see a list of your datasets and can request to get results. This user will also be required to sign a Data Access Agreement if you have required one in the Domain Settings Configurations.

administrator.name: Admin
administrator.description: This role is for users who will help you manage your node. This should be users you trust. The main difference between this user and a Compliance Officer is that this user by default not only can manage requests but can also edit <0>Domain Settings</0>. This is the highest level permission outside of an Owner.
